{{also|durch-}} ==Czech== ===Noun=== {{cs-noun|g=m}} # A single [[deal]] within a game of [[mariáš]] in which one player wins against the other two if he takes all the [[trick]]s. #: {{syn|cs|velký}} #: {{ant|cs|betl}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|durch}}, from {{inh|de|goh|duruh}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*þurhw}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/dʊʁç/|/dʊɐ̯ç/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/dʊɐ̯x/|/dʊɪ̯ç/}} {{a|regionally}} * {{audio|de|De-durch.ogg|audio (Germany}} * {{audio|de|De-at-durch.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Preposition=== {{head|de|preposition}} {{tlb|de|+ accusative}} # by means of; [[by]]; [[through]] # [[through]]; entering, then exiting # [[via]] # owing to; because of # {{lb|de|mathematics}} [[divide]]d by ===Adverb=== {{head|de|adverb}} # [[during]]; [[throughout]]; [[through]] #: {{uxi|de|den ganzen Tag '''durch'''|the whole day '''through'''}} # {{lb|de|colloquial|with a time}} [[past]] #: {{uxi|de|Es ist acht Uhr '''durch'''.|It is '''past''' eight o’clock.}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|durch und durch}} * {{l|de|durchaus}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|durch-}} {{q|used in compounds}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden|durch_hindurch_mittels_waehrend|w=durch (preposition)}} * {{R:Duden|durch_danach_fertig_reif_gar|w=durch (adverb)}}
